column2: mei_wide <- readr::read_table("data/mei_1950_2018.data", skip = 1, col_names = F, n_max = 68) # slightly easier tidyverse way

Parsed with column specification:
cols(
  X1 = col_integer(),
  X2 = col_double(),
  X3 = col_double(),
  X4 = col_double(),
  X5 = col_double(),
  X6 = col_double(),
  X7 = col_double(),
  X8 = col_double(),
  X9 = col_double(),
  X10 = col_double(),
  X11 = col_double(),
  X12 = col_double(),
  X13 = col_double()
)
names(mei_wide) <- c("year",1:12) # add names to columns
mei_long <- mei_wide %>% # reshape the data frame from 'wide' to 'long'
gather(key="month",value="index",-year) %>% # use gather() to assemble key-value pairs
